choices.B: It uses a cloud-based machine learning (ML)-powered web security engine to perform ML-based inspection of web traffic in real-time.
choices.C: It prompts the browser to present a valid client certificate to authenticate the user.
choices.D: Users access the SWG, which then connects the user to the website while still performing security measures.
choices.A: Users are mapped via server logs for login events and syslog messages from authenticating services.

questions.question_text: How does a secure web gateway (SWG) protect users from web-based threats while still enforcing corporate acceptable use policies?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. is the correct answer. 

Here's a quote from the document: "Advanced URL Filtering categorizes and blocks malicious URLs in real-time using a cloud-based ML-powered web security engine."
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/advanced-url-filtering

D. is wrong because this is a general statement and lacks the specific mechanism (ML engine) that provides protection.

Selected Answer: B
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/prisma-access/administration/prisma-access-mobile-users/mobile-users-explicit-proxy

one of the features of Explicit proxy configuration which connects to the Prisma Access SWG is AI/ML-Based Detection. The description is below:

AI/ML-Based Detection Delivers inline, signatureless attack detection and zero-day exploit prevention. Prisma Access adapts and provides instantaneous real-time protection vs. scheduled updates. It prevents up to 95% of unknown threats instantly, with less than 10-second signature delivery, resulting in a 99.5% reduction in infected systems.

Selected Answer: D
Agree with Pretorian, so D.

Selected Answer: D
"D" is correct:
https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/cyberpedia/what-is-secure-web-gateway

B & C are correct
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/cdss

Selected Answer: BC
BC, link provided by Pretorian is correct.

Selected Answer: BC
"B, C" is correct:

https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/network-security/security-subscriptions

questions.question_text: Which two services are part of the Palo Alto Networks cloud-delivered security services (CDSS) package? (Choose two.)
How does the Palo Alto Networks secure access service edge (SASE) solution enable Zero Trust in a customer environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
https://docs.paloaltonetworks.com/best-practices/zero-trust-best-practices/zero-trust-best-practices/what-is-zero-trust-and-why-do-i-need-it

choices.B: It feeds threat intelligence into an automation engine for rapid and consistent protections.
choices.A: It stops attacks that use DNS for command and control or data theft.
choices.C: It classifies sites based on content, features, and safety.
choices.D: It continuously validates every stage of a digital interaction.

questions.question_text: Which two services are provided by Prisma Access Insights? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AD
Prisma Access dashboards provide the following: • Health and performance monitoring for Prisma Access instances, whether you configure and manage your Prisma Access instance with Cloud Manager or Panorama and the Cloud Services plugin. • A summary overview screen of the health and performance of your entire Prisma Access environment. • Customizable alerts notifications, so that you can pinpoint issues or events that require your attention. • Multiple dashboards for focused views of your different deployments, the corresponding alerts, and the health status of the infrastructure. • Flexible user interfaces that allow you to toggle and adjust views and statistics to evaluate trends over different timeframes. • The ability to drill down for details on specific users, sites, connections, or Prisma Access infrastructure components. • Important Prisma Access system messaging, for example upcoming system updates.

Selected Answer: AD
agree with ruben_castro81, AD.

Selected Answer: AD
A y D are correct!. See page 20
https://www.paloaltonetworks.com/apps/pan/public/downloadResource?pagePath=/content/pan/en_US/resources/guides/sase-securing-internet-design-guide
see sase-securing-internet-design-guide

choices.A: summary overview screen of the health and performance of an organization's entire Prisma Access environment
choices.B: configuration of the on-premises firewall located behind the service-connection termination
choices.D: multiple dashboards for focused views of different deployments, the corresponding alerts, and the health status of the infrastructure
choices.C: detection of hard-to-find security issues via AI-based innovations to normalize, analyze, and stitch together an enterprise's data

questions.question_text: Which product enables websites to be rendered in a sandbox environment in order to detect and remove malware and threats before they reach the endpoint?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
it's A, only RBI outsource WEB view into cloud asset (likes sandboxing) instead of executing the webpage into user browser

Selected Answer: A
A is the correct answer

The answer should be 'WildFire' because with RBI, there's no potential for the traffic to reach the endpoint, as the question implies. But since 'WildFire' isn't an option, I'm not sure but I would guess the generic 'network sandbox'...C.
It's A, RBI

Selected Answer: A
Should be RBI, so A.

Selected Answer: A
remote browser isolation

Remote browser isolation—RBI enables websites to be rendered in a sandbox environment in order to detect and remove malware and threats before they reach the endpoint
